title: Onboard deep lossless and near-lossless predictive coding of hyperspectral images with line-based attention
abstract: arXiv:2403.17677v1 Announce Type: cross  Abstract: Deep learning methods have traditionally been difficult to apply to compression of hyperspectral images onboard of spacecrafts, due to the large computational complexity needed to achieve adequate representational power, as well as the lack of suitable datasets for training and testing. In this paper, we depart from the traditional autoencoder approach and we design a predictive neural network, called LineRWKV, that works recursively line-by-line to limit memory consumption. In order to achieve that, we adopt a novel hybrid attentive-recursive operation that combines the representational advantages of Transformers with the linear complexity and recursive implementation of recurrent neural networks. The compression algorithm performs prediction of each pixel using LineRWKV, followed by entropy coding of the residual. translated_title: 在航天器上的高光谱图像深度无损和接近无损预测编码与基于线段的注意力
translated_abstract: 深度学习方法在航天器上对高光谱图像进行压缩传统上是困难的，因为需要大量的计算复杂性来实现足够的表示能力，以及缺乏用于训练和测试的合适数据集。本文摆脱了传统的自编码器方法，设计了一种名为LineRWKV的预测神经网络，通过逐行递归工作以限制内存消耗。为了实现这一目标，我们采用了一种将Transformer的表示优势与递归神经网络的线性复杂度和递归实现相结合的新型混合注意力-递归操作。压缩算法使用LineRWKV对每个像素进行预测，然后对残差进行熵编码。在HySpecNet-11k数据集和PRISMA图像上的实验结果表明，LineRWKV是第一个在性能上表现优异的深度学习方法。
tldr: 本文提出了一种在航天器上压缩高光谱图像的新方法，通过设计递归的预测神经网络LineRWKV，结合了Transformer和递归神经网络的优势，并在实验中取得了优异表现
